alcNumLines.name: alcNumLines
alcNumLines.description: Number of lines/CU's in the table.

alcLineTable.name: alcLineTable
alcLineTable.description: A list of line table entries. The number of entries is given by the value of alcNumLines.

alcLineEntry.name: alcLineEntry
alcLineEntry.description: An entry containing information applicable to a particular ALC line.

alcLineStationType.name: alcLineStationType
alcLineStationType.description: Defines the mode of operation for this line: Primary: We poll terminals, SecondaryPointtopoint: They poll us, we are the only device on the line, SecondaryMultidrop: They poll us, we are sharing the line.

alcNumCuConfiged.name: alcNumCuConfiged
alcNumCuConfiged.description: The number of CUs configured on this line. This count is incremented by one each time the a new CU is added to an underlying structure.

alcDuplexOptions.name: alcDuplexOptions
alcDuplexOptions.description: An option that defines how the protocol should handle polling: poll-immediate: don't wait for pad characters before sending the poll. none: as soon as the CCC is received, start sending the next poll.

alcT3MinCycleTime.name: alcT3MinCycleTime
alcT3MinCycleTime.description: time for a complete poll cycle. (0..1000 millisec) (PRIMARY only) This timer will delay the next live polling cycle if the total polling time per cycle is less than this. (default: 100). UNITS: milliseconds

alcT6SegmentedMsgTimer.name: alcT6SegmentedMsgTimer
alcT6SegmentedMsgTimer.description: (1..xx seconds) Segmented message timer. UNITS: tenths of a second

alcN5LiveDeadRatio.name: alcN5LiveDeadRatio
alcN5LiveDeadRatio.description: polling ratio (1..xxx) (PRIMARY) Number of live-site poll sequences before one dead site poll. (default: 25). UNITS: polls

alcSegmentOption.name: alcSegmentOption
alcSegmentOption.description: This option allows outgoing messages to be split into multiple segments of 'n' characters according to internal rules.

alcReassembleOption.name: alcReassembleOption
alcReassembleOption.description: This option allows incoming messages to be reassembled into multiple a single message.

alcWildIAPoll.name: alcWildIAPoll
alcWildIAPoll.description: Wild card IA polling option enabled/disabled (SECONDARY). Do we accept any IA when we are polled ? (default: disabled).

alcNumOfIdles.name: alcNumOfIdles
alcNumOfIdles.description: GA response with the number of idle pad character specified. (SECONDARY)

alcInterMsgSync.name: alcInterMsgSync
alcInterMsgSync.description: add S1, S2 between concatenated messages for Tx (SECONDARY)

alcNIA.name: alcNIA
alcNIA.description: Next Interchange Address in the GA response (default = 0x37) (SECONDARY)

alcTxOverlengthFrames.name: alcTxOverlengthFrames
alcTxOverlengthFrames.description: A count of the number of overlength frames sent.

alcRxOverlengthFrames.name: alcRxOverlengthFrames
alcRxOverlengthFrames.description: A count of the number of overlength messages received. Where the size of any segment exceeded alcCuN1MaxMsgSize. This is considered a garbled segment/message. Note: a bad CCC was received is held in the RS232-like MIB.

alcInvalidAddresses.name: alcInvalidAddresses
alcInvalidAddresses.description: A count of the number of times a Bad IA was received. This is considered a garbled message.

alcRxT2Expireds.name: alcRxT2Expireds
alcRxT2Expireds.description: A count of the number of times the T2 timer was exceeded. Probably indicating a concatenated message sequence was too long. This is considered a garbled message.

alcDroppedMsgs.name: alcDroppedMsgs
alcDroppedMsgs.description: A count of the number of messages dropped due to the line (eg. RS232 signals) being down.

alcRxOverlengthFramesThres.name: alcRxOverlengthFramesThres
alcRxOverlengthFramesThres.description: The value of alcRxOverlengthFrames at which a alcRxOverlengthFramesTrap is generated. (Overlength single message segments.) UNITS: errors

alcInvalidAddressThres.name: alcInvalidAddressThres
alcInvalidAddressThres.description: The value of alcInvalidAddress at which a alcInvalidAddressTrap is generated. UNITS: errors

alcRxT2ExpiredThres.name: alcRxT2ExpiredThres
alcRxT2ExpiredThres.description: The value of alcRxT2Expired at which a alcRxT2ExpiredTrap is generated. (Overlength concatenated messages.) UNITS: errors

alcTrapReason.name: alcTrapReason
alcTrapReason.description: The reason that the alcLineError trap was generated. rx-overlength-frames - number of 'received data segments that exceeded N1' exceeded its threshold. (overlength single message segments) invalid-address - number of 'invalid addresses received' exceeded its threshold. rx-T2-expired - number of 'received messages that exceeded T2 timer'exceeded its threshold. (overlength concatenated messages)

alcErrData.name: alcErrData
alcErrData.description: An octet string containing as much of the error packet as possible. As a minimum, it must contain the address or as much as was delivered. It is desirable to include all information up to the PDU.

alcLineError.name: alcLineError
alcLineError.description: This trap signifies that one of the thresholds has been exceeded. refer to 'alcTrapReason' for the actual cause.

alcCuTable.name: alcCuTable
alcCuTable.description: A list of Cu table entries. The number of entries is given by the value of alcNumCuConfiged.

alcCuEntry.name: alcCuEntry
alcCuEntry.description: An entry containing information applicable to a particular ALC line.

alcCuIfIndex.name: alcCuIfIndex
alcCuIfIndex.description: The line interface identifier that can be used to locate this IA.

alcCuStatus.name: alcCuStatus
alcCuStatus.description: What is this control units current status. enabledUp: responding to polls, enabledDown: not responding to polls.

alcCuPollCmd.name: alcCuPollCmd
alcCuPollCmd.description: Mode Function Primary Should we be polling this CU? enabled - polling & forwarding data, disabled - not polling & not forwarding. cascade - not polling but forwarding. Secondary Should we respond to polls? enabled - answer poll. disabled - don't answer poll.

alcCuOutQueueMsgSize.name: alcCuOutQueueMsgSize
alcCuOutQueueMsgSize.description: (1..100 messages) default=xx Defines the size of the queue (in messages) that holds outgoing messages (Port bound). UNITS: messages

alcCuOutQueueCharSize.name: alcCuOutQueueCharSize
alcCuOutQueueCharSize.description: (1..xx characters) default=xx Defines the size of the queue (in characters) that holds outgoing messages (Port bound). UNITS: characters

alcCuN1MaxMsgSize.name: alcCuN1MaxMsgSize
alcCuN1MaxMsgSize.description: (1..xx characters) default=960 Maximum length of a single message. UNITS: characters

alcCuT1PollRspTimer.name: alcCuT1PollRspTimer
alcCuT1PollRspTimer.description: Poll response timeout (default = 200 millisec) (PRIMARY) No response to a poll was received before this timeout. UNITS: milliseconds

alcCuT2MaxRxTimer.name: alcCuT2MaxRxTimer
alcCuT2MaxRxTimer.description: (1..65 seconds) default=5 (PRIMARY) Timeout to ensure that the received messages are not overlength. Typically started at: start of poll, or receipt of first character, stopped at receipt of end of message. This is the maximum Rx time for a CU (including concatenated messages) This is considered a garbled msg, if exceeded. UNITS: seconds

alcCuT4NoPollTime.name: alcCuT4NoPollTime
alcCuT4NoPollTime.description: No polls received within this time. (default = 3000 millisecs) (SECONDARY) UNITS: milliseconds

alcCuC1UpCounter.name: alcCuC1UpCounter
alcCuC1UpCounter.description: Number of answered DEAD polls to declare a CU up. (default=1) (PRIMARY only) Equivalent to the secondary variable: alcCuN3PollsTillAlive UNITS: polls

alcCuC2DownCounter.name: alcCuC2DownCounter
alcCuC2DownCounter.description: Number of missed LIVE polls to declare a CU down. (default=3) (PRIMARY only) Equivalent to the secondary variable: alcN4PollsTillDead. UNITS: polls

alcCuN2MaxMsgPerPoll.name: alcCuN2MaxMsgPerPoll
alcCuN2MaxMsgPerPoll.description: maximum number of messages which can be sent to the ACS per POLL. (SECONDARY - multidrop, default=10) UNITS: messages

alcCuMaxCharPerPoll.name: alcCuMaxCharPerPoll
alcCuMaxCharPerPoll.description: maximum number of characters which can be sent to the ACS per POLL. (default=xx) (SECONDARY) UNITS: characters

alcCuN3PollsTillAlive.name: alcCuN3PollsTillAlive
alcCuN3PollsTillAlive.description: number of consecutive POLL commands to declare the CU/circuit available. (SECONDARY) Equivalent to the primary variable: alcC1UpCounter. UNITS: polls

alcCuN4PollsTillDead.name: alcCuN4PollsTillDead
alcCuN4PollsTillDead.description: number of consecutive polling time-outs to declare the CU unavailable. (SECONDARY) Equivalent to the primary variable: alcC2DownCounter. UNITS: polls

alcCuIAResetOption.name: alcCuIAResetOption
alcCuIAResetOption.description: IA reset message is sent when the IA comes alive. (PRIMARY) The message is sent to the polled IA.

alcCuIAValidationOption.name: alcCuIAValidationOption
alcCuIAValidationOption.description: IA Validation: possibly two CUs responding to the same address (PRIMARY) This flag is used with respect to the pollers point of view. none - the message is forwarded on the stream associated with the polled address, (such as for a Cascaded CU, which may send multiple IAs) responding-stream - the message is forwarded on the stream associated with the IA in the responding message, garbled - if the message has an IA that does not match the polled IA, it is counted as a garbled message (alcInvalidAddresses) and is dropped, otherwise it is forwarded on the stream associated with the polled address.

alcCuRxCCCOption.name: alcCuRxCCCOption
alcCuRxCCCOption.description: (PRIMARY) a) <null> entry means no is message sent b) default is preconfigured IA Resend message '<CMD1>=0x1F, <CMD2>=0x38,<EOMc>' c) user can enter their own 'please re-enter' message response. Message must be fully configured: '<IA><TA><CMD1><CMD2><text><EOMc>'

alcCuMaxFrame.name: alcCuMaxFrame
alcCuMaxFrame.description: Number of messages allowed to be sent to a given CU before having to poll all the other CUs on the line (default: 0 = disabled) UNITS: messages

alcCuSvcMsgHeader.name: alcCuSvcMsgHeader
alcCuSvcMsgHeader.description: The is is the header that is sent out whenever the protocol module determines the need to send a service message. This prefix is in the native character set of the protocol. If the value of alcCuSvcMsgIndex is non-zero, then the prefix will be sent followed by the appropriate message followed by the trailer. Typically this header will be: <IA><broadcast TA><CMD1><CMD2> If applicable, the header must include the column and row number where the message must appear.

alcCuSvcMsgIndex.name: alcCuSvcMsgIndex
alcCuSvcMsgIndex.description: This provides the index into the service message table: 'svcmsgTable'. If this index is non-zero, the protocol (when it determines a message is required) will send the alcCuSvcMsgHeader followed by the appropriate message from this row in the svcmsgTable, followed by the alcCuSvcMsgTrailer. Both the header and the trailer are in the native character set of the protocol. However it is the responsibility of the protocol module to translate the text of the actual message into the native character set before transmission.

alcCuSvcMsgTrailer.name: alcCuSvcMsgTrailer
alcCuSvcMsgTrailer.description: This is the trailer sent whenever a service message is sent. It is in the native character set of the protocol. It is only used if the value of alcCuSvcMsgIndex is non-zero. It will typically be: <EOMc>

alcCuStatusChanges.name: alcCuStatusChanges
alcCuStatusChanges.description: A count of the number of times: a) no response to a live poll was received (PRIMARY), b) CU had polling stopped due to T1 timeouts.

alcCuRxFrames.name: alcCuRxFrames
alcCuRxFrames.description: A count of the number of frames received for this CU.

alcCuTxFrames.name: alcCuTxFrames
alcCuTxFrames.description: A count of the number of frames sent to this CU.

alcCuRxChars.name: alcCuRxChars
alcCuRxChars.description: A count of the number of characters received from the CU.

alcCuTxChars.name: alcCuTxChars
alcCuTxChars.description: A count of the number of characters sent to the CU.

alcCuStatusTrapControl.name: alcCuStatusTrapControl
alcCuStatusTrapControl.description: If enabled, it allows the system to generate alcCuState traps, when the CU's status (alcCuStatus) changes to enabled-up, and enabled-down respectively.

alcCuDropped.name: alcCuDropped
alcCuDropped.description: A count of the number of messages dropped due message sent which is not being acknowledged by the CU.

alcCuState.name: alcCuState
alcCuState.description: A trap that indicates that the Cu has changed state. When alcCuStatus is: enabledUp - the CU has exceeded the alcCuC1UpCounter and is now declared up. enabledDown - the CU has exceeded the alcCuC2DownCounter and is now declared down.
